de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.sortable

Class AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseExpandableListAdapter
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.AbstractExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
          • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.itemstate.AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
            • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.sortable.AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Adapter<ExpandableListView>, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, Loggable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFilterableExpandableListAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
extends AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
implements SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary group and child items. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.lang.String CHILD_ORDER_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the current order of all of the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, within a bundle.

      Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary group and child items.

      • CHILD_ORDER_BUNDLE_KEY

        @VisibleForTesting
protected static final java.lang.String CHILD_ORDER_BUNDLE_KEY
        The key, which is used to store the current order of all of the adapter's child items, regardless of the group they belong to, within a bundle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter

        protected AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter(Context context,
                                                Inflater groupInflater,
                                                Inflater childInflater,
                                                DecoratorType decorator,
                                                LogLevel logLevel,
                                                MultipleChoiceListAdapter<Group<GroupType,ChildType>> groupAdapter,
                                                boolean allowDuplicateChildren,
                                                boolean notifyOnChange,
                                                boolean expandGroupOnClick,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterItemClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemClickListeners,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterItemLongClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListAdapterListener<GroupType,ChildType>> adapterListeners,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpansionListener<GroupType,ChildType>> expansionListeners,
                                                boolean setChildEnableStatesImplicitly,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListEnableStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> enableStateListeners,
                                                int numberOfGroupStates,
                                                int numberOfChildStates,
                                                boolean triggerGroupStateOnClick,
                                                boolean triggerChildStateOnClick,
                                                boolean setChildStatesImplicitly,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListItemStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemStateListeners,
                                                java.util.Set<ExpandableListSortingListener<GroupType,ChildType>> sortingListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary group and child items.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        groupInflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the views, which are used to visualize the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type Inflater. The inflater may not be null
        childInflater - The inflater, which should be used to inflate the views, which are used to visualize the adapter's child items, as an instance of the type Inflater. The inflater may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        groupAdapter - The adapter, which should manage the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type MultipleChoiceListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        allowDuplicateChildren - True, if duplicate child items, regardless from the group they belong to, should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        expandGroupOnClick - True, if a group should be expanded, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        expansionListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when a group item has been expanded or collapsed, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        setChildEnableStatesImplicitly - True, if the enable states of children should be also set, when the enable state of the group, they belong to, is set
        enableStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled, as an instance of the type Set, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        numberOfGroupStates - The number of states, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        numberOfChildStates - The number of states, the adapter's child items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        triggerGroupStateOnClick - True, if the state of a group item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        triggerChildStateOnClick - True, if the state of a child item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        setChildStatesImplicitly - True, if the states of children should be also set, when the state of the group, they belong to, is set, false otherwise
        itemStateListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified
        sortingListeners - A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

        A set, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been filtered, as an instance of the type Set or an empty set, if no listeners should be notified

      • sortGroups

        public final void sortGroups()
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        sortGroups in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

      • sortGroups

        public final void sortGroups(Order order)
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's group items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        sortGroups in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortGroups

        public final void sortGroups(java.util.Comparator<GroupType> comparator)
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts the adapter's group items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts the adapter's group items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Specified by:
        sortGroups in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the group items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the group items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • getGroupOrder

        public final Order getGroupOrder()
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns the current order of the adapter's group items.
        Specified by:
        getGroupOrder in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Returns:
        The current order of the adapter's group items as a value of the enum Order or null, if the adapter's group items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sortChildren

        public final void sortChildren(int groupIndex)
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts the child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in an ascending order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        sortChildren in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • sortChildren

        public final void sortChildren(int groupIndex,
                               Order order)
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Sorts child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index, in a specific order. If the underlying data of the adapter's child items does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        sortChildren in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, whose child items should be sorted, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the child items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        public final Order getChildOrder()
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns the current order of all child items, regardless of the group they belong to.
        Specified by:
        getChildOrder in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items as a value of the enum Order or null, if not all child items have been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getChildOrder

        public final Order getChildOrder(GroupType group)
        Description copied from interface: SortableExpandableListAdapter
        Returns the current order of the child items of a specific group.
        Specified by:
        getChildOrder in interface SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the children, whose order should be returned, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The group may not be null. If the group does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The current order of the child items, which belong to the given group, as a value of the enum Order or null, if the child items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING
